Module com.ning.breakout
Package com.ning.breakout.view.graphics

Class SteelBrick

java.lang.Object
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.Brick
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.SteelBrick
public class SteelBrick extends Brick
SteelBrick is the concrete class extend from the abstract class Brick, with full strength of 1.

SteelBrick has a new feature that the steel brick can probably ignore the impact.

Author:
Ning ZHU - modified
See Also:
  • Brick

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.Brick

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SteelBrick(BrickModel model, javafx.scene.Group group)
    The Class constructor sets the model and the view container of the steel brick, binds the layout of the view of the steel brick with the model, adds the view to the container, and specifies the number of effective impacts the steel brick can withstand in total by calling the constructor of super class.

      public SteelBrick(BrickModel model, javafx.scene.Group group)
      The Class constructor sets the model and the view container of the steel brick, binds the layout of the view of the steel brick with the model, adds the view to the container, and specifies the number of effective impacts the steel brick can withstand in total by calling the constructor of super class.

  public Brick3(Point point, Dimension size){
      super(NAME,point,size,DEF_BORDER,DEF_INNER,STEEL_STRENGTH);
      rnd = new Random();
      brickFace = super.brickFace;
  }

  • Method Details

    • impact

      public void impact()
      Simulates impact on steel brick

      The impact probably invalid for steel brick. If the impact is effective, the impact() method of super class will be called. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void impact(){
      if(rnd.nextDouble() < STEEL_PROBABILITY){
          super.impact();
      }
  }
      Overrides:
      impact in class Brick
      See Also:
      • Brick.impact()

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      Sets impact on steel brick.

      If the steel brick is broken after impact, the view of the steel brick will be removed from the container (screen), and the score of steel brick will be set from 0 to specified score 3 for breaking it.

      Notes that arguments are not used here, but for method overriding, these arguments are needed. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public boolean setImpact(Point2D point, int dir){
      if(super.isBroken())
          return false;
      impact();
      return super.isBroken();
  }
      Overrides:
      setImpact in class Brick
      Parameters:
      point - the point where the ball impacts the steel brick
      dir - the impact direction
      Returns:
      the broken status of steel brick after impact
      See Also:
      • Brick.setImpact(Point2D, int)
